description: Number of numbers <= n with a prime factor not in n.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(p) = p-2, for p prime; that is all numbers between 2 and p-1 inclusive. - _Michel Marcus_, May 31 2014
example: For n=5, the three numbers 2,3 and 4 have a prime factor that is not found in 5. Hence a(5) = 3.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {pfn = factor(n)[,1]~; nb = 0; for (i=2, n, pfi = factor(i)[,1]~; for (j=1, #pfi, if (! vecsearch(pfn, pfi[j]), nb++; break););); nb;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, May 31 2014
